DataElement.preferredName: In Situ Hybridization Bioassay Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field used to that refers to how the in situ hybridization assay was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: in situ Hybridization Bioassay Intervention or Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues_A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)_An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues:A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)

Concepts.definition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues.
A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
